results.title: Spotty: the fawn in winter
results.brief_description: Shows Spotty the fawn as he sees his first snow in the forest, and describes how a little girl who puts out food for the animals helps Spotty survive his first winter.

results.title: Spotty: story of a fawn
results.brief_description: The story of the adventures of a wild fawn is used to foster a love of nature and outdoor life among young children. The film was shot in the natural environment of the fawn in the woods of North America and is aimed at stimulating oral and written language development at the kindergarten level.

results.title: Spotswood
results.creator_credit: Mark Joffe, Timothy White, Richard Brennan, Smiley Films and Meridian Films
results.brief_description: Spotswood is an ordinary place where nobody is ordinary, and where business as usual is very unusual! Anthony Hopkins plays Wallace, a time and motion expert who has come to Spotswood to turn the workers at the local moccasin factory from a bunch of eccentric oddballs, into a well-oiled working machine. This quirky film has a great cast, including Ben Mendelshon, Russell Crowe, Bruno Lawrence and Alwyn Kurts and is an epic saga sweeping two suburbs that is refreshing and uplifting comedy at its best!
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mark Joffe, Timothy White, Richard Brennan, Smiley Films and Meridian Films

results.title: Spotlight on smoking
results.brief_description: Graphs show the increase in public smoking and the marked decrease in smoking among doctors. Diagrams show what happens when smoke enters the breathing tubes and the alarming process of uncontrolled cell division which leads to cancer. Shows how mice can suffer from cancer, by painting cigarette tar on their skin. Leading personalities tell why they have given up smoking. Shows what can be bought with the money saved by giving up cigarettes over a year.

results.title: Spotlight on Australian Ballet
results.creator_credit: Doc K Sternberg, Geoff Powell, Loch Townsend, A Anderson and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: A survey of the development of ballet in Australia. The contribution made by such enthusiasts as Edouard Borovansky, Helene Kirsova, Laurel Martyn, Dorothy Stevenson, and other Australian dancers in training and encouraging aspiring dancers, and the untiring efforts of the various corps des ballets, the majority of whom have had to fit in their clases and training, and in many cases, their actual performances, after normal working hours, are presented as the background to the status of ballet in Australia in 1948. Narrated by John Bushelle.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Doc K Sternberg, Geoff Powell, Loch Townsend, A Anderson and Australian National Film Board

results.title: Spotlight
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Participant Media, Anonymous Content, Rocklin / Faust, First Look Media, Michael Sugar, Steve Golin, Tom McCarthy, Wendy Chuck, Josh Singer, Stephen H. Carter, Nicole Rocklin and Blye Pagon Faust
results.headline_credit: Canada and United States of America, 2015
results.brief_description: The true story of how the Boston Globe uncovered the massive scandal of child molestation and cover-up within the local Catholic Archdiocese, shaking the entire Catholic Church to its core.

constellations_other.name: Collective: investigative journalism on screen
constellations_other.description: In Collective, documentarian Alexander Nanau follows a team of journalists who uncover a far-reaching government conspiracy following a deadly nightclub fire in Romania that kills dozens.

constellations_other.name: Uncovering the truth
constellations_other.description: The images of Tank Man during the Tiananmen Square protests in 1989 were captured by photojournalists and shared around the world. The work of journalists has been key to uncovering abuses of power and are rich material for fictional and factual movies and TV.

results.title: Spot news
results.brief_description: Speed is the life blood of the newspaper - by train, telegraph, telephone or radio. Reporters are covering a story of an aeroplane stunt. The reporter takes a photo, its developed in the van they are driving, and then sent via wire to the office.
